intro: Ditaxis desertorum, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows from 10 to 30 centimeters tall, with hairy stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It has adapted to harsh environments by developing deep roots and reduced leaf surfaces to minimize water loss. Its ability to thrive in dry conditions makes it an important component of desert ecosystems.
